atlantis.engine.graphics3d

Class Renderer

  • java.lang.Object
    • atlantis.engine.graphics3d.Renderer

  • public class Renderer
extends java.lang.Object
    The graphics device. It's responsible to draw 3D object on screen.
    Author:
    Yannick

    • Constructor Detail

      • Renderer

        public Renderer(int width,
        int height)
        Create a software renderer. The front and back buffer have the same size. The auto clear flags is disable so you must call clear method before each draw.
        Parameters:
        width - Desired width.
        height - Desired height.

      • Renderer

        public Renderer(int screenWidth,
        int screenHeight,
        int backBufferWidth,
        int backBufferHeight,
        boolean autoClear)
        Create a software renderer.
        Parameters:
        screenWidth - Screen width.
        screenHeight - Screen height.
        backBufferWidth - Back buffer width.
        backBufferHeight - Back buffer height.
        autoClear - Enable or disable auto clear.

             int y,
             float z,
             java.awt.Color color)

        y - Value of Y coordinate.

      • drawLine

        protected void drawLine(Vector3 pointA,
            Vector3 pointB,
            java.awt.Color color)
        Draw a line with two Vector2 using Bresenham's line algorithm.
        Parameters:
        pointA - Start point.
        pointB - End point.

      • sortPoints

        protected void sortPoints(Vector3 pointA,
              Vector3 pointB,
              Vector3 pointC)
        Sort points of a triangle to have PA -> PB -> PC (in this order)
        Parameters:
        pointA - First point of the triangle.
        pointB - Second point of the triangle.
        pointC - Third point of the triangle.

      • drawTriangle

        protected void drawTriangle(Vector3 pointA,
                Vector3 pointB,
                Vector3 pointC,
                java.awt.Color color)
        Draw a triangle in back buffer.
        Parameters:
        pointA - First point of the triangle.
        pointB - Second point of the triangle.
        pointC - Third point of the triangle.
        color - The color that be used to fill the triangle on screen.
